title.narrative: Resiliency in Northern Ghana (RING) Technical Assistance

description.narrative: (Ghana): This follow-on activity provides technical assistance to district assemblies in the Northern and Upper East regions, and the Northern and Upper East Regional Coordinating Councils, to implement programs that address key constraints to improved livelihoods and nutritional well-being. This technical assistance activity accompanies the TBD Nutrition and Resiliency G2G mechanism which aims to improve the livelihood and nutritional status of targeted communities in the Northern and Upper East regions, where food insecurity and poor nutrition outcomes are pervasive. The interventions will incorporate agriculture; livelihood; nutrition; water, hygiene, and sanitation; and governance and public financial management activities. This activity supports the local governments to plan, implement, and monitor these programs by training extension workers; coaching local government leadership; augmenting the local governments' human resources with temporary technical assistance staff; and building expertise and skills in global best practices in nutrition and agriculture. In addition, the activity strengthens the local governments' public financial management systems and practices. The activity provides targeted support to improve the districts' planning, monitoring and evaluation systems. The activity supports Ghana to reduce preventable child and maternal deaths and contributes to the Mission's Feed the Future Multi-Year Strategy.
